guide.title: Document Management Guide
guide.subtitle: Learn how to create, approve and distribute documents step by step.

creation.title: Creating a Document
creation.step1Desc: Enter a unique document code (e.g., DOC-001) and document name. Optionally add a description to explain the document's purpose.
creation.step2Desc: Select the document type (Procedure, Instruction, or Form) and the department that owns the document.
creation.step3Desc: If you are uploading on behalf of another department, select the preparer department. Otherwise, leave it empty.
creation.step4Desc: Choose who will review and approve the document. Only users with Manager or Admin roles are listed.
creation.step5Desc: Choose which departments and/or individual users should receive the document after it is published. You can select both.
creation.step6Desc: Upload the document file by dragging and dropping or clicking to browse. Then submit the form.

lifecycle.title: Document Lifecycle
lifecycle.subtitle: Every document goes through these stages:
lifecycle.draft: Document is created as a draft and submitted for approval.
lifecycle.pendingApproval: The assigned approver receives an email notification and reviews the document.
lifecycle.intermediateApproval: If there are multiple approval levels, the first approver has approved. Waiting for final approval.
lifecycle.approved: The document has been approved and is ready to be published by the document owner.
lifecycle.published: The document is distributed to all users in the distribution list. Read tasks are created automatically.
lifecycle.revision: A new version is uploaded. The document goes through the approval process again.
lifecycle.passive: Previous revisions become passive when a new revision is published.
lifecycle.cancelled: The document is cancelled. All related parties are notified.

afterPublish.title: What Happens After Publishing?
afterPublish.notifications: All users in the distribution list receive an email notification about the new document.
afterPublish.readTasks: Each user gets a read task. They must open the document and confirm they have read and understood it.
afterPublish.tracking: The document owner can track read status in real time — who has read and who hasn't.
afterPublish.reminders: Automatic reminder emails are sent to users who haven't read the document within the configured period.
afterPublish.escalation: If a user still hasn't read after the reminder period, the task is escalated to their manager.

tips.title: Tips
tips.tip1: Use meaningful document codes that follow your organization's naming convention.
tips.tip2: Add a description to help users understand the document's purpose before opening it.
tips.tip3: Select both departments and individual users in the distribution list when needed — duplicates are handled automatically.
tips.tip4: After approval, review the document one more time before publishing, as publishing triggers distribution immediately.
